text:

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
sebb@apache.org
text:
Jmeter version 1.5 is very old.
I suggest you upgrade to the recent 2.0 release.

If the problem still occurs, please re-open the bug and provide more details, 
e.g. Java version, and OS.

It would also help to upload a copy of jmeter.log and the test plan (JMX).

Created attachment 11236
Test case as described in "The Apache  Jakarta Project", 5. Building a WEb Test Plan.  All is same except for Listeners.
creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us

text:
The test fails for me too, as the hostname "jakartka.apache.org" (sic) from the 
request defaults page does not seem to exist.
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Try adding a "View Results Tree" Listener, as this will give more information 
on the error.

If you want any further help, please also post jmeter.log and jmeter.properties.

Please also confirm JVM details and JMeter version

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
text:
I have been able to solve problem I was having and am now getting 0% error.

However, I would like to enter data  into the web site - such as Last Name for 
a client, etc.  How do I go about doing this?  Thanks.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: What did you do to solve the problem?

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
text:
I took off part of URL and added to Port Number.  

So that's okay, but I want to test entering data into boxes in web pages and 
even though with  parameters it runs without errors, I don't know if it 
actually entered the data correctly.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Closing the call - this is not really a Bugzilla issue any more.

Questions such as these are best asked on the JMeter User mailing list.

The JMeter FAQ and other documentation may also prove helpful.

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I took a look at the second test plan you attached and it had port "8080" in 
the path instead of port. Is the test plan similar to the second test plan you 
posted?

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
text:
Yes, I am working on the same test plan and while having success running 
without errors now, I need to know how to confirm that data entered into the 
web pages are being committed correctly.

Thank you.
